channel.title: Can I buy laptop components to build my own?
channel.description:
I'm making a wifi/internet controlled robot for fun and as I have no experience with low level electronics, it would be a lot easier if I could just run linux on a laptop and control shit via the parallel port. I could also easily attach a USB webcam, a microphone and a speaker.
If I could buy laptop components individually this would allow me more size flexibility and not require the pointless screen. I could also have just one battery for everything, rather than an additional battery for the other shit the robot does.
Anywhere I can buy them from that deliver to the UK? Alternative suggestions to achieve what I'm doing?

item.title: Can I buy laptop components to build my own?
item.dc:creator: @chri5 chri5
item.source: Can I buy laptop components to build my own?

item.title: Can I buy laptop components to build my own?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Have you ever thought about an older cheap android phone? It already has USB, wifi, a camera, speakers, and a microphone, and you can write programs for it. You wouldn’t need it to be activated, so you could probably pick up a Droid 1 or similar with a bad ESN (can’t be activated) for $20 or less on ebay or craigslist.

Read full topic
item.source: Can I buy laptop components to build my own?

item.title: Can I buy laptop components to build my own?
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

PicoITX have usb and sata ports

Read full topic
item.source: Can I buy laptop components to build my own?

item.title: Can I buy laptop components to build my own?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:2, topic:407542”]It would probably be easier and potentially more fun to use either a PIC or one of those new fangled system on a chips like the *duinos. It’s not really that much more low level than what you’re already describing, it’s just not x86.

If you insist on x86 though, why laptop components and not something like PicoITX?[/quote]Wouldn’t it be difficult to set up wifi and webcam on a PIC?

The PicoITX does look appropriate, but I don’t really understand how I’m supposed to use it. Is it just like a standard motherboard (but tiny and stripped down) that I can just add a wifi card and hd to? Also, they seem to be around £200 but I could just get a netbook with wifi etc for less. That was just from a quick google search though.

Read full topic
item.source: Can I buy laptop components to build my own?

item.title: Can I buy laptop components to build my own?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

It would probably be easier and potentially more fun to use either a PIC or one of those new fangled system on a chips like the *duinos. It’s not really that much more low level than what you’re already describing, it’s just not x86.

If you insist on x86 though, why laptop components and not something like PicoITX?

Read full topic
